channel.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
channel.description:
Since I love to mess around with clients and seeing just how much cool things I can do I will be releasing several snippets/tutorials on some really cool and unique client features.
[code] public int PlayerX = 128;//default 128 public int PlayerY = 128;//default 128 public int PlayerHeight = 128;//default 128[/code]
Search for [code]model_1.method479(64, 850, -30, -50, -30, true);[/code]
under that add [code]if (PlayerX != 128 || PlayerY != 128 || PlayerHeight != 128) {//dont change these model_1.method478(PlayerX, PlayerY, PlayerHeight); }[/code]
To change it around just change the 128's to any digit in [code] public int PlayerX = 128;//default 128 public int PlayerY = 128;//default 128 public int PlayerHeight = 128;//default 128[/code]
pictures!:
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/33nf4i8.png[/img]

item.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
item.dc:creator: @droidmobile droidmobile@yahoo.com
item.description:
@droidmobile wrote:

How can I change the size of the actual client? CBF to change my characters size l0l

Read full topic

item.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
item.dc:creator: @Im_Mad_1337 Im_Mad_1337
item.description:
@Im_Mad_1337 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]i believe this will do

private void sendPlayerSize(Stream str, int pX, int pY, int pZ) { str.writeDWord(pX); str.writeDWord(pY); str.writeDWord(pZ); }then call that method during player constructing/updating
also you need to make the client read these variables.[/quote]Any way you could explain that to somebody with nearly no Java knowledge? If no, that’s cool, don’t wanna be asking to be “spoon-fed” :o

Read full topic

item.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
item.dc:creator: @Im_Mad_1337 Im_Mad_1337
item.description:

I Vain I:

^ stream the variable to the client from the server. ^

How would I go about doing that? I’m complete shit when it comes to stuff like this.

Read full topic

item.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
item.dc:creator: @ravens ravens
item.description:
@ravens wrote:

this might seem completely useless, but for PI full screen clients the player is often not proportionally small compared to the regular sized client, perhaps it can be automatically toggled with the full-screen mode.

this would also be funny to go on some persons server and be like 3 times as big as everyone else ;D

Read full topic

item.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
item.dc:creator: @Im_Mad_1337 Im_Mad_1337
item.description:
@Im_Mad_1337 wrote:

zyle1992:

Or, so that you don’t have to alter the updating protocol, you could just add a client-side command (search for “noclip” or “fpson”)

My client doesn’t have “noclip”, think you could tell me how to add it? Sorry, don’t mean to be “spoonfed” just can’t find a guide on that. Thanks a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: [Renamed/PI]Resizing character models (AWESOME!)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Im_Mad_1337 link=topic=490564.msg3613930#msg3613930 date=1306816141]
Awesome, I got it to work, Thanks. Is it possible to make a command to change the character size? Or make it so only administrators are a different size?
[/quote]you would need to stream the variables from the server to the client.[/quote]

Or, so that you don’t have to alter the updating protocol, you could just add a client-side command (search for “noclip” or “fpson”)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Im_Mad_1337, post:16, topic:393398”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=490564.msg3610618#msg3610618 date=1306551913]
You’re not supposed to find it, you’re supposed to add it. Lol.
[/quote]
Where exactly would I add this? I’m really new to [PI].[/quote]

PI is a server, not a client. This is client sided. It goes in player.java client side.

Read full topic

item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:393398”]the titan gonna squish you like a bug^^

<3 you nick nice snippet.[/quote]

Not in the first pic

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:12, topic:393398”]This… is actually pretty sweet. Nice job.

It’s the fucking name of an int? You can change it… Or are you not capable of that?

You’re naming it wrong. What the fuck is playerX and playerY. The variable obviously doesn’t control the player’s x and y.
You didn’t have to try to act tough. It just made you look dumber.

Can I smack him?[/quote]

Please do.
